content.title: Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions: One-Man Shows
content.details: The 'Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions: One-Man Shows' was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage talented artists in the field of painting and sculpture by granting ₹25,000/- for conducting 'one-man show' art exhibitions. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.
eligibility: The applicant should be an artist.
The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu by continuous residence for not less than 5 years.
The applicant should have continuous involvement in his/her field of painting and sculpture.
The applicant should possess an adequate number of artworks for the conduct of his/her show.
Participation in National or State level Art Exhibitions and Artists Camps will be considered as an additional qualification.
exclusions: The students of fine arts are not eligible.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu (Tamil Nadu Fine Arts Academy) and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned staff. Fill in all mandatory fields, attach copies of all mandatory documents, and submit the application form either directly or by post to the Member Secretary, Tamil Nadu Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu, Directorate of Art and Culture, Dr. D.G.S. Dinakaran Road, (Greenways Road) Chennai - 600 028.
documents_required: Copies of Press Cuttings (if any) published in Newspapers/Journals on their Artistic Talents

faqs.question: What is the objective of the 'Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions: One-Man Shows'?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to encourage talented artists in the field of painting and sculpture by granting ₹25,000/- for conducting 'one-man show' art exhibitions.

faqs.question: How are applications for the scheme accepted?
faqs.answer: Applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.

faqs.question: What is the grant amount provided under this scheme?
Where can interested applicants obtain the application form?
faqs.answer: Interested applicants can visit the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu during office hours and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned staff.

faqs.question: What documents are required for the application?
faqs.answer: Documents required include bio-data of the applicants, artist photographs, artworks photographs, and copies of press cuttings (if any published in newspapers/journals on their artistic talents).

faqs.question: What should applicants do if they encounter any difficulties during the application process?
faqs.answer: Applicants should seek assistance from the staff at Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu or contact the designated authority for guidance and support.

faqs.question: What is the address for submitting the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form should be submitted to the Member Secretary, Tamil Nadu Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu, Directorate of Art and Culture, Dr. D.G.S. Dinakaran Road, (Greenways Road) Chennai - 600 028.

faqs.question: Can artists from outside Tamil Nadu apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must be native to Tamil Nadu with continuous residence for at least 5 years.

faqs.question: How does participation in National or State level Art Exhibitions and Artists Camps affect eligibility?
faqs.answer: Participation in such events is considered an additional qualification for eligibility under the scheme.

faqs.question: How should applicants submit the required documents?
faqs.answer: Applicants should attach copies of all mandatory documents, ensuring they are self-attested if required.

faqs.question: Can applicants submit their completed application forms through postal services?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants have the option to submit their completed application forms either directly or by post to the designated authority.

faqs.question: What details should the receipt or acknowledgment contain?
faqs.answer: The receipt or acknowledgment should include essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number if applicable.
